properties.description: This is where Marathwada Chemicals is located, which I have assumed is the type of organization in which Bridgestone acquires some of the chemicals needed to produce tires.  These chemicals include zinc stearate, wax, accelerators, and antioxidants and antiozonants.
properties.title: Usmanpura, India- Chemical Supplies

properties.description: This is where I have assumed Bridgestone purchases their sulfur.  Suncor energy produces sulfur as a by-product of oil refining.  This location seems suitable and accessible for Bridgestone.
properties.title: Alberta, Canada- Sulfur Supply

properties.description: This is the third carbon black plant that Bridgestone operates.  It employs roughly 100 people of Mexico, and is the location used to supply the North American tire manufacturing plants.

properties.description: This is the first carbon black plant that Bridgestone operates.  Carbon black is a key ingredient in the production of truck tires.

Commodity Chain Analysis- Bridgestone Truck Tire
properties.description:
This is a map representing the global production locations of the Bridgestone truck tire.  This illustrates the geographies of the different stages and processes involved.
This is fairly detailed, but if zoomed in, each location can be expanded and more clearly viewed.
